topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: How to Change min-part-time

body.p: The following procedures allow you to change the min-part-time.

strow.stentry: In the cloud model ring-specifications, the min-part-time attribute specifies how many hours you must wait between ring rebuilds. If you change the min-part-time attribute, this is not reflected in the ring files and it only applies at the time the rings are created.

You can change the values as follows:
Log into the first server running the swift-proxy service.
Go to the /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/region-<region-name> directory
where <region-name> is the region-name field in your cloud model (For example: region1 in most example files).
Search for files with a .builder extension.
Run the following command against each builder file. For example, to change the value to 16 hours for the account builder file, the command is as follows: sudo swift-ring-builder account.builder set_min_part_hours 16
You should also update the ring-specifications (usually in data/swift/rings.yml) to contain the same value for the min-part-time.

body.p: You can also refer to ring specification for more details about the min-part-power.
